node.title: 'Here is your baby, I think he's going to die': After 42 years, Jaii continues to defy all the odds
node.alt: Photograph of a young baby sleeping in blankets.
node.description: As Kay Mitchell cradled a bundle of blankets at Adelaide Airport she "hoped to goodness" her tiny adopted son from IndiaÂ was alive.
node.content:
["Kay Mitchell remembers waiting with anticipation at Adelaide Airport with her young family for their newest member \u2014\u00a0an adopted baby boy from India.", "She knew he'd be small but she expected a relatively healthy baby.", "\"A lady came off [the plane] with a bundle of blankets in her arms and I thought 'this could be him',\" Kay said.", "\"And she thrust the blankets into my arms.\"", "The first thing Kay noticed was the lack of weight in the blankets.", "\"Things became quite chaotic very quickly.", "\"I just held him and hoped to goodness he was alive. I really didn't know at that stage.\"", "", "
Soon after arriving in Adelaide, Jaii underwent brain surgery.(Supplied: Kay Mitchell)
", "She remembers it still\u00a0being light as her family, including\u00a0her then-husband and their three daughters who had already travelled five hours from Whyalla, rushed from\u00a0the airport to the Women's and Children's Hospital late on January 25, 1980.", "\"As we drove along, I started to peel the blankets back and I finally found his head. I remember looking at it thinking, oh my God, it's no bigger than the size of a large apple,\" Kay said.", "During Jaii's first stint at\u00a0Adelaide's children's hospital, he was diagnosed with suspected blindness, pneumonia, a heart murmur and a collapsed lung.", "He was also suffering from dehydration and malnutrition.", "\"He fed well while he was there, he began to grow so in the end they sent us home and said he would need to come to Adelaide quite regularly,\" Kay said.", "", "
Jaii and carer Alison enjoy a day out in Mount Gambier.(ABC South East SA: Bec Whetham)
", "In the 42 years since, Jaii has battled an array of health complications and surgeries \u2014\u00a0many considered potentially\u00a0fatal.", "Originally Kay planned to write her son's story after his death, but his incredible will to survive has inspired her book\u00a0Jaii's Journey: My Boy with a Broken Wing.", "\"When Jaii just continued to be strong and refused to give in then I began to feel that his story deserved to be told.", "
The first decade was the hardest
", "A few months after their first hospital stay, Jaii's head began to swell up.", "He had fluid on the brain, hydrocephalus. A shunt was inserted into his brain.", "\"Then [the doctors] came after the surgery\u00a0and said\u00a0Jaii had an infection on the brain, possibly prenatally,\" Kay said.", "The communication centre of his brain was most affected. The diagnosis was he would be deaf as well blind.", "", "
Jaii Mitchell at 14 months old.(Supplied: Safari Smith)
", "In June 1980 Jaii's twitches began and he was eventually diagnosed with a degenerative brain pattern.", "\"Normally it means too much damage has been done to survive, and they (the doctors)\u00a0told me in no uncertain terms that we would lose him within six months.\"", "It wouldn't be the first time Jaii would go on to defy doctors' expectations.", "
Jaii wouldn't give up, even when others did
", "Jaii ended up being able to see, quite well in fact.", "\"[And] he lost the degenerative brain pattern that the doctors told me so definitely he could not survive.", "\"His neurosurgeon said he had no medical explanation for why it happened.\"", "Jaii\u00a0still has\u00a0ongoing chest problems as well as being deaf and is these days confined to a wheelchair.", "", "
The Mitchells\u00a0didn't realise Jaii could see until he was five years old.(Supplied: Safari Smith)
", "Jaii's relaxed nature is Kay's source of encouragement.", "\"[After a major crisis]\u00a0I think I can't do that again, I just can't do it and then I go and look at Jaii,\" Kay said.", "During one of those crises, Jaii nearly drowned while with a school group\u00a0at a swimming pool.", "Eighteen-year-old Jaii was flown from Mount Gambier, South Australia, where his family was\u00a0living\u00a0to an Adelaide hospital for treatment.", "He was in peripheral shutdown, and doctors said he wouldn't survive.", "It was yet another hurdle for the pair to overcome.", "", "
Jaii Mitchell (left) with a friend in 1997, just weeks before his near-drowning at a pool.\u00a0(Supplied: Safari Smith)
", "\"The doctors in intensive care, because he was an adult, told me that if they believed he was going to be more disabled than he was before they weren't going to advocate treatment,\" Kay said.", "\"They were absolutely adamant, but they did ask me if I had any photos to prove what sort of quality of life he had. Fortunately, I did have a couple [with me].\"", "Jaii\u00a0eventually made it home after a week's ordeal in ICU, although on anti-psychotic drugs\u00a0to get him \"back onto an even keel\".\u00a0", "\"He used to have panic attacks at nights and it meant full-time carers, and it meant I had to stop working for a while,\" Kay said.", "
No point getting frustrated
", "After Jaii's treatment and unsure whether she'd be able to return to work, Kay sued the Education Department.", "\"We were proven correct. Yes, they were negligent with what happened to him.\"", "Kay said because Jaii was already diagnosed as disabled prior to the near-drowning\u00a0the\u00a0judge's payout, which was based on loss of income, was low.", "", "
Kay and Jaii Mitchell on holiday.(Supplied: Safari Smith)
", "\"It really just broke my heart and made the whole grief process worse because it just made me face that my son is worth very little compared to a normal person.\"", "Kay says she's been angry multiple times.", "
Jaii's life a gift to others
", "Kay has at times blamed herself for bringing\u00a0Jaii to Australia\u00a0and using its advanced medical system\u00a0to \"condemn him to a life of severe disability\".", "\"He's always facing uncertainty, one with pain, two with mobility and three, how long he can survive like that.", "\"I used to think it was all for no reason. But now I know it was to lead the life that he has led ... to touch others.", "", "
Jaii Mitchell surrounded by his family.(Supplied: Safari Smith)
", "Kay's three daughters and another son now work in caring roles;\u00a0two registered nurses, an aged care worker, and another is in mental health.", "Friends have become occupational therapists, physiotherapists and a teacher of the deaf.", "\"All those families have said to me their children had done this because they grew up with Jaii,\" Kay said.", "She believes people who know someone like Jaii have a genuine care for people living with disabilities.", "", "
Touching hands has always been a source of loving communication between Kay and her son.(ABC South East SA: Bec Whetham)
", "Raising Jaii \u2014\u00a0despite requesting a child without a disability on the adoption papers \u2014\u00a0has had a major impact on Kay.", "\"I suddenly found that I could carry a load heavier than I thought I could, and there's something gratifying in that.", "\"I have learned that people, children particularly, have their own incredible self-will to survive.", "\"[Not] giving up on them before they\u2019re ready to give up on themselves I think, as a parent, is the most paramount thing we can offer them.\"", "She credits Jaii for developing her ability to empathise with others.", "\"Now I can see pain in other people's faces. I can listen to people, whereas I would have been embarrassed before and tried to avoid them. Not because I wouldn't have cared but because I wouldn't have known what to say.\"", "", "
Kay Mitchell spends a lot of her time thinking about Jaii.(ABC South East SA: Bec Whetham)
", "Kay visits Jaii most days in his group home.", "\"When I finally lose the battle I know I'm going to be kicking and screaming about it, but I've done what I can for him, for as long as I can.\""]
